title: Monthly Demand
text: This page explores bike usage patterns between two separate months, revealing differences and trends in user behavior dependent upon time.

title: Monthly Demand
text: This page explores bike usage patterns between two separate months, revealing differences and trends in user behavior dependent upon time.

title: Citi Bikes
text: Every day, people use bikes from the CitiBike network in New York City to get around- whether it be to the high rises in Manhattan or to the nearest deli, this gives us information on how a large part of the population moves. I gathered this data from the CitiBikes in New York, specifically from the months of June and December 2024, as well as their feed of live data. My main goal in this project was to explore different facets of the experience as a CitiBike rider and trying to analyze the data to see what’s found. Most users follow the general trends you see in other forms of transportation, though the exceptions are to be explored going forth.

title: Casual vs. Member Usage
text: This page examines the differences in casual CitiBike usage vs. how CitiBike members use their bikes. Ride durations, hourly patterns, and average ride times uncover insights on how these two groups differ in usage.

title: Casual vs. Member Usage

title: About
text:
I am Angelo Morelli (angelomorelliam08@gmail.com), a Computer Science student at NCF.
This project was an exploration of trends among CitiBike riders in New York City, and was created as part of David Kane’s Techne: Getting the Future you Want ISP.
Data Sources:
Live Data: GBFS Citi Bike NYC
Historical Data: Trip Data (used June/Dec 2024)
Sources:
Deepseek: Deepseek AI

title: Hourly Demand
text:
Bike Demand, by Hour of the Day
As people head to work, grab lunch, or return home, Citi Bikes play a crucial role in urban mobility, trending with the “rush hour” schedule of the average person’s daily transportation.
